Description: Girdle: composed of many disc beads of varying diameters of white shell and pink limestone, now strung in a single row.
Findspot: Found/Acquired: Mostagedda, Grave 544 Found at the waist of a woman
Curator's comments: Also from this burial: bangle (1929,1015.468), bracelet with amulet (1929,1015.469), girdles (1929,1015.470 & 1929,1015.472 & 1929,1015.473), necklaces (1929,1015.474 & 1929,1015.475). Bibliography: G. Brunton, ‘Mostagedda and the Tasian Culture’ (London, 1937), 101-2; Tomb register, pl.XLVIII; Bead register, pl.XLIXA.
Bibliographic references: Andrews 1981 / Catalogue of Egyptian Antiquities. Jewellery I (322)
